comments.body: i spent too much time debating this in my head, it should be obvious .. .but my soul darkens a bit realizing I WILL inevitably have to point to this doc when someone w/o connectivity complains about it not working ...
Hehe... well at least open_url will handle proxies consistently. I can delete it, but I figured it doesn't hurt anything to have it in there.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +11,15 @@version_added: "2.5"
requirements:
  - must have public internet connectivity
short_description: Look up the IP ranges for services provided in AWS such as EC2 and S3.
description:

comments.body: shouldn't the open_url have it's own exception handling for connectivity/access errors?
is there a way to minimize the data queried instead of filtering after the response?

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +77,81 @@        if 'service' in kwargs:
            service = str.upper(kwargs['service'])
            amazon_response = (item for item in amazon_response if item['service'] == service)

        return [item['ip_prefix'] for item in amazon_response]
